lines.gurmukhi: jYsy myG brKq hrKiq hY kiRswin iblK bdn loDw lon gir jwq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Maygh Barakhat Harakhati Hai Krisaani , Bilakh Badan Lodhaa Lon Gari Jaat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a farmer is delighted to see the rainfall but the face of a weaver becomes ashen and he feels restless and miserable.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy prPulq huie skl bnwspqI sukq jvwso Awk mUl murJwq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Paradhulat Hui Sakal Banaasapatee , Soukat Javaaso Aak Mool Murajhaat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as all the vegetation turns green with the fall of rain but the plant of camel thorn (Alhagi maurorum) withers while akk (Calotropis procera) dries out right from its roots.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy Kyq srvr pUrn ikrK jl aUc Ql kwlr n jl Tihrwq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Khayt Saravar Pooran Kirakh Jala , Ooch Dal Kaalar N Jal Tthahiraat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as ponds and fields are filled with water when it rains, but no water can accumulate on mounds and saline land.

lines.gurmukhi: gur aupdys prvys gurisK irdY swkq skiq miq suin skucwq hY ]518]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Oupadays Paravays Gursikh Ridai , Saakat Sakati Mati Souni Sakouchaat Hai ?518?
